topics.body:
"@toxicrystal":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5596152a636872434c0016d4#post_5596152a636872434c0016d4
There are certain things I don't mind spoils of.

But when it comes to movies pleeeeeeaaase don't spoil anything. It makes me not that hype to see the movie.

For starters Intersteller. *I got spoiled on the ending to the movie literally the day before I saw it*.

I was super pissed too. And the reason I got spoiled was because I was on one of Max's (Also known as Yo Video Games) stream and his stupid friend Simmons decided that DAY ONE lets go home and do a stream and spoil the movie for millions of people! And have no warning! 

Even Max was just like "Wow dude, Spoilers much?"

Simmons: "Yeah but I didn't say what movie it was!"

No fuck you we know what movie you are talking about!
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
You know what I would love to see in a board game?  Something with even more moves than chess, but rules as simple to understand but more friendship ruining than monopoly.

The problem with chess is that yes there are more moves than there are atoms in the universe, but most of the strategies are predictable as fuck and as a result chess isn't about intelligence but pattern memory.  If you have a simple board game with more moves than all the atoms in every universe not even supercomputers would be able to play it without losing occasionally.
